chefs.name: Gordon Ramsay
chefs.short_bio: Gordon James Ramsay OBE is a British celebrity chef, restaurateur, television personality and writer. His restaurant group, Gordon Ramsay Restaurants, was founded in 1997 and has been awarded 17 Michelin stars overall; it currently holds a total of seven.

chefs.name: Bobby Flay
chefs.short_bio: Bobby Flay is a renowned American chef who has made a name for himself in the culinary world through his passion for bold flavors and innovative cooking techniques. With a career spanning over three decades, Bobby has become a household name and has cemented himself as one of America's most celebrated chefs.

chefs.name: Ina Garten
chefs.short_bio: Ina Rosenberg Garten is an American author, host of the Food Network program Barefoot Contessa, and a former staff member of the Office of Management and Budget. Among her dishes are Perfect Roast Chicken, Weeknight Bolognese, French Apple Tart, and a simplified version of beef bourguignon.

chefs.name: Anthony Bourdain
chefs.short_bio: Anthony Michael Bourdain was an American celebrity chef, author, and travel documentarian who starred in programs focusing on the exploration of international culture, cuisine, and the human condition.

chefs.name: Emeril Lagasse
chefs.short_bio: Emeril John Lagass√© III is an American celebrity chef, restaurateur, television personality, cookbook author, and National Best Recipe award winner for his 'Turkey and Hot Sausage Chili' recipe in 2003

chefs.name: Mario Batali
chefs.short_bio: Mario Francesco Batali is an American chef, writer, and former restaurateur. Batali co-owned restaurants in New York City; Las Vegas; Los Angeles; Newport Beach, California; Boston; Singapore; Westport, Connecticut; and New Haven, Connecticut.
